react
Class AbstractSignal<T>

java.lang.Object
  react.Reactor<Slot<T>>
      react.AbstractSignal<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
SignalView<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Signal, UnitSignal
public class AbstractSignal<T>
extends Reactor<Slot<T>>
implements SignalView<T>

Handles the machinery of connecting slots to a signal and emitting events to them, without exposing a public interface for emitting events. This can be used by entities which wish to expose a signal-like interface for listening, without allowing external callers to emit signals.

Method Detail

map

public <M> MappedSignalView<M> map(Function<? super T,M> func)
Description copied from interface: SignalView
Creates a signal that maps this signal via a function. When this signal emits a value, the mapped signal will emit that value as transformed by the supplied function.

Specified by:
map in interface SignalView<T>

connect

public Connection connect(Slot<? super T> slot)
Description copied from interface: SignalView
Connects this signal to the supplied slot, such that when an event is emitted from this signal, the slot will be notified.

Specified by:
connect in interface SignalView<T>
Returns:
a connection instance which can be used to cancel the connection.

disconnect

public void disconnect(Slot<? super T> slot)
Description copied from interface: SignalView
Disconnects the supplied slot from this signal if connect was called with it. If the slot has been connected multiple times, all connections are cancelled.

Specified by:
disconnect in interface SignalView<T>
